oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Abstract K, Abstract of Articles Issued on Special Requisition
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Military equipment & supplies; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office; Confederate States of America -- Army -- Supplies and stores
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This one-page handwritten form is an Abstract K, recording information that will be reflected in the quarterly return known as the Return of Quartermaster Stores (Form No. 23). Listed here by the regimental quartermaster are the dates, voucher numbers, requesting officers, and items of clothing or camp equipage that were requested by special requisition at Shelbyville by officers from the 5th Tennessee Regiment, C. S. A., during a three-month period.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The return of quartermaster stores report was one of the four required quarterly reports that had to be turned in within twenty days of the end of the quarter. Quarterly returns were more comprehensive than monthly reports and required vouchers and abstracts, such as this one, for support. The return of quartermaster stores report was the main summary document for non-financial transactions during the Civil War.
